lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.view.gui.comcompany

Class CommunicationCompanyGUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.view.gui.abstractgui.AbstractGUIController
      • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.view.gui.comcompany.CommunicationCompanyGUIController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasTables

    public class CommunicationCompanyGUIController
extends AbstractGUIController
implements HasTables
    The Class CommunicationCompanyGUIController, used for controlling the GUI for the communication company. The GUI is an example of how the system might work, but normally the would create an alert by a separate API that has access to the server.

      • createAlertForm

        private void createAlertForm()
        Creates the alert form inside the Anchor pane. Since controls are being generated by other places, this seemed simpler than manually adding the controls myself via scenebuilder.

      • checkDataAndSend

        public PtBoolean checkDataAndSend(double hour,
                                  double minute,
                                  double second,
                                  int year,
                                  int month,
                                  int day,
                                  EtHumanKind humanKind,
                                  java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                                  java.lang.String latitude,
                                  java.lang.String longitude,
                                  java.lang.String comment)
        Checks the data is OK and if so will send it.
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour on the clock when the accident happened
        minute - The minute on the clock when the accident happened
        second - The second on the clock when the accident happened
        year - The year of the accident
        month - The month of the accident
        day - The day of the month of the accident
        humanKind - The type of human reporting the accident
        phoneNumber - The phone number of the human who is reporting the accident
        latitude - The latitude of the accident
        longitude - The longitude of the accident
        comment - The message sent by the human about the accident
        Returns:
        The success of the method
